this.translation[0].definitions[0].defin: used to refer to a person, thing, idea etc that has just been mentioned or to something that has just happened
this.translation[0].definitions[0].examp: We must make sure this doesn’t happen again.
Is there any way of solving these problems?
If young Daly continues to improve at this rate, he’ll soon be in the A Team.
This will be discussed in the next chapter.
This boyfriend of yours – how old is he?
this.translation[0].definitions[1].defin: used to talk about the present time or a time that is close to the present
this.translation[0].definitions[1].examp: There will be another meeting later this week.
This has been the worst year of my life.
I thought he would have been back before this.
We’ll be seeing Malcolm this Friday  (=on Friday of the present week).
I’m sorry I was late this morning  (=today in the morning).
Everyone seems to be in a hurry these days (=at the present period).
I want to see you in my office this minute (=immediately).
this.translation[0].definitions[2].defin: used to talk about the present situation
this.translation[0].definitions[2].examp: I hate this cold damp weather.
Things have never been as bad as this before.
this.translation[0].definitions[3].defin: used to talk about a thing or person that is near you, the thing you are holding, or the place where you are
this.translation[0].definitions[3].examp: These are your gloves, aren’t they?
You have to park on this side of the road.
I can’t bear the atmosphere in this house much longer.
this.translation[0].definitions[4].defin: used to refer to something that you are going to say or that is just about to happen
this.translation[0].definitions[4].examp: Wait till you hear this joke.
This is going to surprise you.
this.translation[0].definitions[5].defin: used in stories, jokes etc when you mention a person or thing for the first time
this.translation[0].definitions[5].examp: I met this really weird guy last night.
Suddenly, there was this tremendous bang.
this.translation[0].definitions[6].defin: used to introduce someone to someone else
this.translation[0].definitions[6].examp: Sam, this is my sister, Liz.
this.translation[0].definitions[7].defin: used to give your name when you are speaking on the telephone
this.translation[0].definitions[7].examp: ‘Can I speak to Joan, please?’ ‘This is Joan speaking.’
this.translation[1].definitions[0].defin: used to say how big, how much etc, when you are showing the size, amount etc with your hands
this.translation[1].definitions[0].examp: The table’s about this high and this wide.
You need to cut about this much off the end of the pipe.
this.translation[1].definitions[1].defin: as good, bad, much etc as in the present situation
this.translation[1].definitions[1].examp: I hadn’t realised that things had got this bad.
I’ve never had this much money before.
